001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.StringKit;
004
005import java.io.Serializable;
006
007/**
008 * A RandomnessSource with three {@code long} states that changes its state with three ways it can connect states to
009 * other states. This has been backported from jdkgdxds, which got this from SquidSquad originally. This generator has
010 * an unknown period that is statistically extremely likely to be very long (more than 2 to the 64), and no combinations
011 * of states are known that put it in a bad starting state or one with a shorter period. It is a very fast generator,
012 * particularly on Java 16 and newer. It has passed 64TB of PractRand testing with no anomalies, and 4PB of hwd testing.
013 * <br>
014 * TricycleRNG, it's got three states and it cycles changes between them.
015 * <br>
016 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 7/13/2021.
017 */
018public class TricycleRNG implements RandomnessSource, Serializable {
019    private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
020    /**
021     * Can be any long value.
022     */
023    public long stateA;
024
025    /**
026     * Can be any long value.
027     */
028    public long stateB;
029
030    /**
031     * Can be any long value.
032     */
033    public long stateC;
034
035    /**
036     * Creates a new generator seeded using Math.random.
037     */
038    public TricycleRNG() {
039        this((long) ((Math.random() - 0.5) * 0x10000000000000L)
040                ^ (long) (((Math.random() - 0.5) * 2.0) * 0x8000000000000000L),
041                (long) ((Math.random() - 0.5) * 0x10000000000000L)
042                ^ (long) (((Math.random() - 0.5) * 2.0) * 0x8000000000000000L),
043                (long) ((Math.random() - 0.5) * 0x10000000000000L)
044                ^ (long) (((Math.random() - 0.5) * 2.0) * 0x8000000000000000L));
045    }
046
047    public TricycleRNG(long seed) {
048        setSeed(seed);
049    }
050
051    public TricycleRNG(final long seedA, final long seedB, long seedC) {
052        stateA = seedA;
053        stateB = seedB;
054        stateC = seedC;
055    }
056    /**
057     * This initializes all 3 states of the generator to random values based on the given seed.
058     * (2 to the 64) possible initial generator states can be produced here, all with a different
059     * first value returned by {@link #nextLong()} (because {@code stateA} is guaranteed to be
060     * different for every different {@code seed}).
061     * @param seed the initial seed; may be any long
062     */
063    public void setSeed(long seed) {
064        long x = (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L);
065        x ^= x >>> 27;
066        x *= 0x3C79AC492BA7B653L;
067        x ^= x >>> 33;
068        x *= 0x1C69B3F74AC4AE35L;
069        stateA = x ^ x >>> 27;
070        x = (seed += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L);
071        x ^= x >>> 27;
072        x *= 0x3C79AC492BA7B653L;
073        x ^= x >>> 33;
074        x *= 0x1C69B3F74AC4AE35L;
075        stateB = x ^ x >>> 27;
076        x = (seed + 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L);
077        x ^= x >>> 27;
078        x *= 0x3C79AC492BA7B653L;
079        x ^= x >>> 33;
080        x *= 0x1C69B3F74AC4AE35L;
081        stateC = x ^ x >>> 27;
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Get the "A" part of the internal state as a long.
086     *
087     * @return the current internal state of this object.
088     */
089    public long getStateA() {
090        return stateA;
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Set the "A" part of the internal state with a long.
095     *
096     * @param stateA any 64-bit long
097     */
098    public void setStateA(long stateA) {
099        this.stateA = stateA;
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Get the "B" part of the internal state as a long.
104     *
105     * @return the current internal "B" state of this object.
106     */
107    public long getStateB() {
108        return stateB;
109    }
110
111    /**
112     * Set the "B" part of the internal state with a long.
113     *
114     * @param stateB any 64-bit long
115     */
116    public void setStateB(long stateB) {
117        this.stateB = stateB;
118    }
119
120    /**
121     * Get the "C" part of the internal state as a long.
122     *
123     * @return the current internal "C" state of this object.
124     */
125    public long getStateC() {
126        return stateC;
127    }
128
129    /**
130     * Set the "C" part of the internal state with a long.
131     *
132     * @param stateC any 64-bit long
133     */
134    public void setStateC(long stateC) {
135        this.stateC = stateC;
136    }
137
138
139    /**
140     * Using this method, any algorithm that might use the built-in Java Random
141     * can interface with this randomness source.
142     *
143     * @param bits the number of bits to be returned
144     * @return the integer containing the appropriate number of bits
145     */
146    @Override
147    public int next(final int bits) {
148        final long fa = this.stateA;
149        final long fb = this.stateB;
150        final long fc = this.stateC;
151        this.stateA = 0xD1342543DE82EF95L * fc;
152        this.stateB = fa ^ fb ^ fc;
153        this.stateC = Long.rotateLeft(fb, 41) + 0xC6BC279692B5C323L;
154        return (int)fa >>> (32 - bits);
155    }
156    /**
157     * Using this method, any algorithm that needs to efficiently generate more
158     * than 32 bits of random data can interface with this randomness source.
159     * <p>
160     * Get a random long between Long.MIN_VALUE and Long.MAX_VALUE (both inclusive).
161     *
162     * @return a random long between Long.MIN_VALUE and Long.MAX_VALUE (both inclusive)
163     */
164    @Override
165    public long nextLong() {
166        final long fa = this.stateA;
167        final long fb = this.stateB;
168        final long fc = this.stateC;
169        this.stateA = 0xD1342543DE82EF95L * fc;
170        this.stateB = fa ^ fb ^ fc;
171        this.stateC = Long.rotateLeft(fb, 41) + 0xC6BC279692B5C323L;
172        return fa;
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * Produces a copy of this RandomnessSource that, if next() and/or nextLong() are called on this object and the
177     * copy, both will generate the same sequence of random numbers from the point copy() was called. This just need to
178     * copy the state so it isn't shared, usually, and produce a new value with the same exact state.
179     *
180     * @return a copy of this RandomnessSource
181     */
182    @Override
183    public TricycleRNG copy() {
184        return new TricycleRNG(stateA, stateB, stateC);
185    }
186    @Override
187    public String toString() {
188        return "TricycleRNG with stateA 0x" + StringKit.hex(stateA) + "L, stateB 0x" + StringKit.hex(stateB) + "L, and stateC 0x" + StringKit.hex(stateC) + 'L';
189    }
190
191    @Override
192    public boolean equals(Object o) {
193        if (this == o) return true;
194        if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
195
196        TricycleRNG tricycleRNG = (TricycleRNG) o;
197
198        return stateA == tricycleRNG.stateA && stateB == tricycleRNG.stateB && stateC == tricycleRNG.stateC;
199    }
200
201    @Override
202    public int hashCode() {
203        return (int) (421L * (stateA ^ (stateA >>> 32)) + 29L * (stateB ^ (stateB >>> 32)) + (stateC ^ stateC >>> 32));
204    }
205    
206//    public static void main(String[] args)
207//    {
208//        /*
209//        cd target/classes
210//        java -XX:+UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:+PrintAssembly sarong/ThrustAltRNG > ../../thrustalt_asm.txt
211//         */
212//        long seed = 1L;
213//        ThrustAltRNG rng = new ThrustAltRNG(seed);
214//
215//        for (int i = 0; i < 1000000007; i++) {
216//            seed += rng.nextLong();
217//        }
218//        System.out.println(seed);
219//    }
220
221}
